snippet: The Islamic State said Friday that Jordanian bombings in Syria intended to avenge the immolation of a captured pilot had killed an American hostage, Kayla Mueller, who was held by the group.
abstract: Islamic State militant group announces that Kayla Mueller, American hostage held for nearly 17 months, was killed after building collapsed from Jordanian airstrike; Mueller's identity had been closely guarded secret by government officials and reporters, but ISIS declaration spurs her family to reveal her prolonged captivity; Mueller, who hailed from Prescott, Ariz, had been working for aid organization helping Syrian refugees when she was kidnapped.

byline.original: By RUKMINI CALLIMACHI and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Eric Schmitt and Julie Hirschfeld Davis from Washington; Rana F. Sweis and Ranya Kadri from Amman, Jordan; Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon; and Sheri Fink from New York.

lead_paragraph: The Islamic State said Friday that Jordanian bombings in Syria intended to avenge the immolation of a captured pilot had killed an American hostage, Kayla Mueller, who was held by the group.

headline.main: ISIS Declares Airstrike Killed a U.S. Hostage
headline.print_headline: ISIS Declares Airstrike Killed a U.S. Woman

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
